title.narrative: PROTECTION AGAINST VIOLENCE

description.narrative: By September 2015, the national family welfare system and the justice system, as well as local communities, have increased their capacity to protect children and adolescents from violence, exploitation, abuse and other violations of their rights, consistent with applicable national and international law., which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection Systems, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By September 2015, institutional and community environments have enhanced their capacity to prevent and protect children and adolescents from violence, exploitation, and the effects of the armed conflict and natural disasters.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By September 2015, the national family welfare system and the justice system, as well as local communities, have increased theircapacity to protect children and adolescents from violence, exploitation, abuse and other violations of their rights, consistentwith applicable national and international law.
Number of tourist entities certified by The Code

baseline.value: 53 tourism entities have been certified by The Code

target.value: 2014:40 new tourism entities certified by “The Code”

actual.value: 2015:In the first semester 2015, 56 new tourism operators were certified with The Code, thus completing a total of 234 tourism operators certified from 2010 to september 2015.

title.narrative: The institutions that are part of the Penal Responsibility System for Adolescents have set guidelines for better implementation of the system, regarding critical points identified by the study Progress and Challenges in the implementation of the Law on Children and Adolescents and by the document elaborated by the the commission conformed by the Congress of the Republic in 2011 to evaluate the System.
Institutions of the National Family Welfare National System strengthened in their knowledge to protect children from violence.

baseline.value: In July 2011, one of the top fifteen institutions of the SNBF * in process of incorporating training on child rights in their training regular processes.

title.narrative: A resolution on the protection of indigenous children from violence and exploitation in the Amazon indigenous communities, in implementation

baseline.value: In July 2011, there is no resolution

title.narrative: A protocol for guaranteeing access to civil registration of children of indigenous people in Colombia (exists / not exists)

target.value: 2014:Colombia has a protocol to guarantee the civil registration of children members of indigenous groups.

actual.value: 2015:Partially achieved. A protocol document in civil registration among indigenous children was published in the report of the National Committee for Indigenous Children in 2012. The Government is following-up the implementation of the measures established in the publication.
